results.name: wall·e
results.description: After 700 years alone on earth as the last Waste Allocation Load Lifter Earth-Class, WALL-E has developed a glitch--a personality.

results.name: eve
results.description: A sleek, state-of-the-art Extra-terrestrial Vegetation Evaluator, EVE is always laser-focused on her directive.

results.name: auto
results.description: The Axiom's autopilot for all of its 700 years in space, Auto is cold, mechanical, and a bit controlling of the Captain.

results.name: vn-go
results.description: A painting bot complete with a multi-color fibrous pigment distribution system for all of the Axiom's painting needs.

results.name: vaq-m
results.description: An accordion-necked vacuum-bot aboard the axiom. Programmed to clean and scrub, but prone to sneezing fits.

results.name: pr-t
results.description: A robotic hairdresser aboard the Axiom, programmed to make small-talk as she styles hair with her cutting edge styling technology.

results.name: hal
results.description: An extremely resistant and loyal cockroach who survives on dessert snack, Hal is WALL-E's pet and best pal on Earth.

results.name: m-o
results.description: Microbe Obliterator M-O is a cleaner-bot who loves to clean away all foreign contaminants that find their way onto the Axiom.

results.name: l-t
results.description: A light-bot aboard the Axiom. L-T requires a 120 watt dual-setting halogen bulb, and boasts an anti-gravity magnetic airframe.

results.name: han-s
results.description: One of the Axiom's many massage-bots, complete with soothing visual display and an even-tempered behavioral mod chip.

results.name: go-4
results.description: Small but easily identifiable with their red lights, GO-4 units are charged with overseeing security on the Axiom.

results.name: d-fib
results.description: The Axiom's defib-bot, sometimes prone to delivering a bit too much charge through their paddles. Often heard saying “clear!?

results.name: brl-a
results.description: An umbrella-bot, used to provide shade while on the Axiom more often than to protect passengers from rain.
